reviewText:
As the title says you will get 5 classic games you used to play back in good old days on windows XP or 98 :) 2 things missing are minesweeper and pinball, but maybe they will release 1 more pack in the future.Another thing i noticed all the games are water themed, anyway about those games:

Tetris:
+3 Different mods
+Different difficulties
+looks nice
- tutorial is for phone version of the game (aint sure if anybody even need tutorial for tetris srsly)
i.e. - worth to buy

Mahjong:
+Looks nice, very classy
+Nice music
+Has 2 different mods with 2 difficulties
-You cant pause and save progress, so each game must be completed, when you leave the it just counts how much points you managed to get so far as a result.
i.e. - worth to buy

Sudoku:
+Has 5 difficulties
+Music is nice
+Has pause button (if you click menu)
-No saving progress upon leaving, so you have to complete the whole level or leave uncompleted and get your points
-Even the easiest difficulty was kinda frustrating for me, so i cant really tell the difference
¯\_(ツ)_/¯
i.e. - definitely worth to buy since there is lack of sudoku games on steam

Words:
+Great game itself for expanding english vocabulary
+You can reroll the set of letters and it shows all possible combinations for those letters (like 8x3 5x4 1x6), so you know where to dig
+Nice music
+button to shuffle letters so you may see some word you missing
-When the time is up, it would be cool if the game would show those words you missed, but its not :)
i.e. - worth to buy

Solitary:
+Pirates themed cards looks okay
+2 mods with hidden cards and with visible cards
+Sea themed music
-Tutorial doesnt explain rules of this one version of solitary so you have to figure them out yourself
-Cant say i really like this one solitary, basically at steam you can find a lot of other solitaries, which would be better
i.e. Not really worth it

So in total i rate this pack 4/5 which is pretty nice. Now overall:
+Very low cost for what you get
+Games are nice
-Some of the tutorials explains how to play this game from the phone :|? Hope they fix that in the future
-Lack of settings changes like resolution, window size, music loudness etc
-No achievements and steamcards :(

reviewText: A must have for cooldown from hard games! Very Peaceful!
voteText: 2 of 8 people (25%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: Don't come into this expecting more than it presents, but what it does it does really well. Great menus and settings, nice interfaces, pleasant to look at and play, it's 5 games in one well-made package.
